Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Facilitated proton transport through intrinsic channels, interfacial acid-base pairs, and hydrophilic hydration layers.

Other Information.Additional Info: Provides more proton transport channels and accelerates proton conduction. Proton conduction via Grotthus and vehicle mechanisms. Activation energy (Ea) is 11.0 kJ mol−1.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size sieving and Donnan repulsion effect.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 1.7 M VO2+/4.7 M H2SO4 electrolytes at 30 ℃
Other Information.Additional Info: Effectively suppressed crossover leading to ultrahigh ion selectivity.

Sieving Mechanism: Synergistic size screening and Donnan repulsion

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: BET surface area: 282.1 m2 g−1, Proton conductivity: 98.3 mS cm−1, VO2+ permeability: 5.1 × 10-7 cm2 min−1, Ion selectivity: 192.7 × 103 S min cm−3, Energy efficiency: 87.1 % at 100 mA cm−2, Self-discharge time: 127 h.

Other Information.Additional Info: Zwitterionic polymer-functionalized MOF (PSBMA grafted onto UiO-66-NH2). Used as filler in sulfonated poly(ether ether ketone) (SPEEK) composite membranes for vanadium redox flow batteries. Retains crystalline structure after modification. Demonstrates enhanced mechanical and chemical stability under harsh conditions.
